messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] raffle questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/13/2003 6:01:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I have no aversion to ANYTHING! One man s trash... ... Sounds humorous! If not, practical!
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/13/2003 6:01:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:
> Raffle talk:
>
> Kelly, what are your raffle rules?
> Holly just put a homeschooling t-shirt in the charity box for tomorrows
> pick-up but I pulled it back out and said "No! A homeschooler needs this!"
>
> Do you have an aversion to used clothes of that special nature?


I have no aversion to ANYTHING! One man's trash...

> I also came across a denim jumper that I wore quite a bit years ago before
> it
> became the Mark of Virtue for conservative homeschoolers. I could write up
> and sign a certificate of authenticity. I remember some people (the
> non-U.S.
> readers mostly) who didn't know what an exotic "denim jumper" might be!

Sounds humorous! If not, practical! <G> And there *are* some non-US residents
coming!

> I also have the set of four Schoolhouse Rock videos. We got it on DVD. So
>
> those would be used too... Yes? (If no, that's okay.)

That's good too.

We have a neat array already! Pam Genant just sent me two HUGE boxes of toys
and Yu-Gi-Oh! cards and a copy of Harry Potter 5 and, and, and ---all SORTS of
stuff! Duncan's already saving his money up for the conference---he wants
SOOO many things (and it must be *so* hard to have them in his own dining room
and not able to touch! :-(

THANKS, PAM!!! I promise a personal thank you for this when I see you
online---I must've *just* missed you while I was in the shower!

I think there's a market for all sorts of used things----especially books and
games.

The more, the merrier! Bring 'em on! And Thanks!

~Kelly



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: raffle questions
messages.msgSnippet: Raffle talk: Kelly, what are your raffle rules? Holly just put a homeschooling t-shirt in the charity box for tomorrows pick-up but I pulled it back out and
messages.messageBody:
Raffle talk:

Kelly, what are your raffle rules?
Holly just put a homeschooling t-shirt in the charity box for tomorrows
pick-up but I pulled it back out and said "No! A homeschooler needs this!"

Do you have an aversion to used clothes of that special nature?

I also came across a denim jumper that I wore quite a bit years ago before it
became the Mark of Virtue for conservative homeschoolers. I could write up
and sign a certificate of authenticity. I remember some people (the non-U.S.
readers mostly) who didn't know what an exotic "denim jumper" might be!

I also have the set of four Schoolhouse Rock videos. We got it on DVD. So
those would be used too... Yes? (If no, that's okay.)

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
